response_parsed.title: Observing Web Backends Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide provides a comprehensive walkthrough on how to use FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+, to observe and monitor your web backends.
key_points: Install FastAPI and Uvicorn (an ASGI server) using pip
Create a new FastAPI application by importing the FastAPI module and instantiating an instance
Define API routes, including route paths, methods (GET, POST, etc.), and endpoint functions
Use middleware to add additional functionality such as request logging or rate limiting
Implement dependency injection to manage application-level state and resources
Test your FastAPI application using various tools like Postman, curl, or built-in test clients
Deploy the FastAPI application to a production environment using modern deployment techniques (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes)
Leverage FastAPI's OpenAPI support for generating API documentation and client SDKs
